item.title: Report X-2024010779
item.description:
Report X-2024010779

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: PORTAGE
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was located in the middle of the trailer on the floor leaking. QA took steps to remediate the spill ny putting the package in a hazmat leaker tote. The tote was moved to the HAZMAT cage for processing. DescribePack: Cap was leaking DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed package in leaker tote for later processing.

item.title: Report E-2024010535
item.description:
Report E-2024010535

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-05T15:13:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-29
  • City: FLINT
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Enviroserve was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 5ft-by-2ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released due to a puncture into one (1) 330-gallon plastic tote. Enviroserve personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and recovered the spent material and placed it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The remaining product in the damaged tote was transferred to a new tote and the damaged plastic tote was cut-up and placed into the previously mentioned 55-gallon poly tote and one additional 95-gallon poly drum. The new plastic tote was shipped onto the consignee and the generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.
